prompt_prefix:
create table person (
    person_id integer primary key,
    name varchar(20) not null,
    email varchar(20) not null,
    join_date date not null
);

create table game (
    game_id integer primary key,
    title varchar,
    price decimal(5,2)
);

create table purchase (
    purchase_id integer primary key,
    game_id integer not null,
    person_id not null,
    purchase_date date,
    foreign key (person_id) references person (person_id),
    foreign key (game_id) references game (game_id)
);

create table review (
    review_id integer primary key,
    person_id integer not null,
    game_id integer not null,
    comment text,
    rating smallint not null,
    timestamp datetime,
    foreign key (person_id) references person (person_id),
    foreign key (game_id) references game (game_id)
);

create table tag (
    tag_id integer primary key,
    name varchar
);

create table game_tag (
    game_id integer not null,
    tag_id integer not null,
    primary key (game_id, tag_id)
); Give me a sqlite select statement that answers the question. Only respond with sqlite syntax. If there is an error do not explain it!

questionResults.question: What is the highest rated game?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT g.title, AVG(r.rating) AS average_rating
FROM game g
JOIN review r ON g.game_id = r.game_id
GROUP BY g.game_id
ORDER BY average_rating DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: The highest-rated game is "Space Invaders" with an average rating of 4.0.

questionResults.question: What is the highest rated game from verified purchasers?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT g.title, AVG(r.rating) as average_rating
FROM game g
JOIN purchase p ON g.game_id = p.game_id
JOIN review r ON p.person_id = r.person_id AND p.game_id = r.game_id
GROUP BY g.game_id
ORDER BY average_rating DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: The highest-rated game from verified purchasers is "Battle Arena," with an average rating of 5.0.

questionResults.question: Who has purchased the most action games?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT p.name
FROM purchase pu
JOIN person p ON pu.person_id = p.person_id
JOIN game_tag gt ON pu.game_id = gt.game_id
JOIN tag t ON gt.tag_id = t.tag_id
WHERE t.name = 'action'
GROUP BY p.person_id
ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: Based on the query and the empty results data returned, it appears that no person in your database has purchased any action games.

questionResults.question: What games have the most tags?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT g.title, COUNT(gt.tag_id) AS tag_count
FROM game g
JOIN game_tag gt ON g.game_id = gt.game_id
GROUP BY g.game_id
ORDER BY tag_count DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: The game with the most tags in your database is "Space Invaders," which has 2 tags.

questionResults.question: What game has generated the most revenue?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT game.title, SUM(game.price) AS total_revenue
FROM purchase
JOIN game ON purchase.game_id = game.game_id
GROUP BY game.game_id
ORDER BY total_revenue DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: The game that has generated the most revenue is "Mystic Quest," with a total revenue of $59.98.

questionResults.question: What genre receives the best reviews?
questionResults.sql:
SELECT t.name AS genre, AVG(r.rating) AS average_rating
FROM review r
JOIN game g ON r.game_id = g.game_id
JOIN game_tag gt ON g.game_id = gt.game_id
JOIN tag t ON gt.tag_id = t.tag_id
GROUP BY t.name
ORDER BY average_rating DESC
LIMIT 1;
questionResults.friendlyResponse: The genre that receives the best reviews is "Retro," with an average rating of 4.0.
